Posts.Content: Oh, Sweetheart - we have all been where you are now and know it is SUCH a scary place. Five years down the line and I know that it is possible to overcome this - survival rates for BC are brilliant! Waiting is, as said before, is the worst part but you are at the start of a journey... If you have immediate questions do remember the wonderful nurses here on this site who are on hand to answer questions. They operate Monday to Friday 9am to 8pm on freephone 0808 808 0000. Best wishes KateG
Posts.Title: Diagnosed last week- waiting for biopsy results

Posts.Content: Hello again Ladies .   As I pointed out in an earlier reply yesterday, there is a group on the site where discussions of this genre can be more suitably posted ( please refer back to it if interested ) Whatever your views on the subject of religion are, the main object of this Community is to offer help and support to cancer patients / their carers / relatives ...... not to risk causing offence to others. Thank you. Joycee
Posts.Title: How to stop / deal with religious comments

Posts.Content: Please don't suffer in silence - talk to one of the lovely nurses here on this site and I'm sure they will help. They operate Monday to Friday 9am to 8pm on freephone 0808 808 0000. Best wishes KateG
Posts.Title: crackly and wheezy

Posts.Content: Gosh - this is an old thread! I belong to a BC patient group and all those taking Tamoxifen agree that they have memory problems - especially remembering people's names. It is annoying but we generally laugh - explain to people that we're on a drug which screws with our memory and they are very understanding. Best wishes KateG
